encyclopedia.content: untie 英[ʌn'tai]美[ʌn'tai] v.[I,T] 1.松开，解开 v.[T] 1.解除；使自由 2.解决 v.[I,T] 1.松开，解开 v.[T] 1.解除；使自由 2.解决 时 态：untied,untying,unties 点击查看…… 同反义词 参考例句 "Mrs. Wang is the one who started it all.'Whoever ties the bell around the tiger's neck must untie it.' 这都是汪太太生出来的事，‘解铃还须系铃人。’Twisted and unable to untie 纠缠不开Untie t

entry.def: If you untie something that is tied to another thing or if you untie two things that are tied together, you remove the string or rope that holds them or that has been tied round them.

example.ex: Nicholas untied the boat from her mooring...
example.tran: 尼古拉斯把泊船的绳缆解开。
赶快把绑住我的手的绳子解开。

entry.def: If you untie something such as string or rope, you undo it so that there is no knot or so that it is no longer tying something.

example.ex: She hurriedly untied the ropes binding her ankles...
example.tran: 她连忙解开绑着脚踝的绳子。

example.ex: Then she untied her silk scarf.

entry.def: When you untie your shoelaces or your shoes, you loosen or undo the laces of your shoes.

example.ex: She untied the laces on one of her sneakers...
example.tran: 她解开了一只鞋的鞋带。
